2.name: Big Clicks
2.description: Cid has the unique ability to strengthen your clicks. Upgrade her to make your clicks more powerful.

3.name: Huge Clicks
3.description: Cid's unique ability can grow in power, allowing you to click harder.

4.name: Massive Clicks
4.description: "We make a great team," Cid says. "Let's get this upgrade and we'll be an even better team."

5.name: Titanic Clicks
5.description: Cid looks off into the distance and wonders, "What could be bigger than Titanic?"

6.name: Colossal Clicks
6.description: "Colossal clicks are bigger than Titanic clicks. We should get this one. I don't think there could be anything bigger," Cid says.

7.name: Clickstorm
7.description: "I was surprised too, but it turns out we can upgrade these even further," Cid says. "I suspect you've gotten tired of clicks, though. Maybe you don't need this one?"

8.name: Monumental Clicks
8.description: "The final upgrade. These clicks are so big that every time you click, they build a monument to commemorate it."

9.name: Spear Training
9.description: "I've only ever used this spear for fishing. I need to learn how to use it better in combat."

10.name: Crab Net
10.description: "I'll have a way to get food with very little effort." Your team will be grateful for this..

11.name: Whetstone
11.description: "I used to have one of these. No idea what happened to it." If he can sharpen his spear, he will do more damage.

12.name: Fish Cooking
12.description: "Betty's been teaching me. We'll be able to cook fish for the team!"

13.name: Combat Makeup
13.description: You doubt she'll use it for camouflage like she's supposed to. In fact, she probably doesn't even know what "camouflage" means.

14.name: Brand Name Equipment
14.description: "I'm not like other girls. I would never, like, take you for granite," she says.

15.name: Elixir of Deditzification
15.description: The effect of this elixir may be too mild to notice at first glance, but Brittany's combat prowess will improve significantly.

16.name: Vegan Meat
16.description: With the help of the Great Forest Seer, he performs a "blessing" on your cooked meats to make them vegetarian, so Brittany can eat them.

17.name: Fertilizer
17.description: Treebeast grunts with approval as you consider this upgrade. It will make him grow stronger.

18.name: Thorns
18.description: Sharp points on Treebeast's weapon that help cut up enemies.

19.name: Megastick
19.description: A really big stick for Treebeast.

20.name: Ultrastick
20.description: The biggest stick in the forest.

21.name: Hard Cider
21.description: An appetizer for a long night of drinking.

22.name: Pint of Ale
22.description: Ivan likes a pint, to take the edge off his edge.

23.name: Pitcher
23.description: Ivan throws his inhibitions to the wind and his fists into the faces.

24.name: Pint of Pig's Whiskey
24.description: It's so strong that it would put chest hairs on your great Aunt Sally, if she didn't already have them.

25.name: Wilderburr Dumplings
25.description: Delicate and oh so delicious, these delightful morsels make you very vigorous.

26.name: Braised Flamingogo Casserole
26.description: "You know what they say. An army runs on good homemade Casseroles."

27.name: Truffled Trollgre with Bloop Reduction
27.description: "A new dish I came up with. It's exquisite."

28.name: Foomgus Risotto
28.description: "One bite and you won't have to eat for days. It has something to do with the magical qualities of the Foomgus."

29.name: Jutsu I
29.description: The Masked Samurai says he knows the greatest swordfighting teacher in the world. This training will greatly benefit his abilities.

30.name: Jutsu II
30.description: You've never seen him train with this "Great Teacher" he always refers to. But his combat skills have improved, so what do you have to complain about?

31.name: Jutsu III
31.description: What if he's lying? What if he's just holding back his DPS for money, and doing a bit extra each time you pay for his "training"?

32.name: Jutsu IV
32.description: He's probably making everything up. Roman numerals don't even belong with Japanese words! Ah well, what can you do? The added damage would be useful.

33.name: Courage Tonic
33.description: He's pretty strong, but fearful of things. This tonic will help him overcome his fears. It smells like paint thinner.

34.name: Stronger Claws
34.description: A more powerful replacement for Leon's current claws.

35.name: Lionheart Potion
35.description: A magic concoction that allows Leon to truly believe in himself.

36.name: Lion's Roar
36.description: With his tonics and potions, Leon is finally capable of roaring like a real lion. This provides a boost to your entire team.

37.name: Forest Creatures
37.description: The Seer can call upon the forest creatures to do his bidding. Enraged rabbits, squirrels, and birds will launch themselves at your opponents.

38.name: Insight
38.description: "Leon is not a real lion," he says. "And Brittany is vain." These, and other important insights that only the Seer can know, will help your entire team.

39.name: Dark Lore
39.description: "I must not shy away from the world of darkness," he tells you. This upgrade will grant him greater power, and the capability for terrifying upgrades in the future.

40.name: Swarm
40.description: The Seer can control the arthropods with this grotesque power. Spiders, millipedes, and other bugs weave in and out of his clothing, and will swarm your enemies at his command.

41.name: Critical Strike
41.description: An improvement to Alexa's knowledge of monster anatomy. She hits to kill.

42.name: Clairvoyance
42.description: An improvement to her ability to see surroundings without her eyes, increasing her combat prowess.

43.name: Poisoned Blades
43.description: "Don't use these as steak knives," she warns.

44.name: Invisible Strikes
44.description: Imbued with great speed, Alexa's attacks having become blindingly fast as to appear invisible.

45.name: Magic 101
45.description: This book is standard reading at any Mage university. It would be cruel to keep her from studying it.

46.name: Below Zero
46.description: Canonical undergraduate Ice reading. She needs it to become a successful Ice Mage.

47.name: Frozen Warfare
47.description: A graduate-level book on using Ice Magic for combat purposes. Personally recommended by Jerator.

48.name: The Book of Frost
48.description: A frigid mist billows out of this rare book, owned only by the greatest Ice Wizards. Natalia's eyes are wide with desire.

49.name: Mithril Edge
49.description: By reinforcing the edge of her blade with Mithril, she can cut through much more difficult materials.

50.name: Enchanted Blade
50.description: With the research and help of some of your more magic-inclined friends, Mercedes' blade can be empowered with magic.

51.name: Quickblade
51.description: Another upgrade to her sword, giving her a much faster swing. "Nobody's head will be safe from me."

52.name: Blessed Sword
52.description: "My sword, she's already historic. If she receives a blessing from the gods, I'll have to give her a name..."

53.name: Impressive Moves
53.description: You get the impression that these moves are not really optimized for battle damage, but for looks.

54.name: Acrobatic Jetpack
54.description: "I need this upgrade so I can move in and out of combat more efficiently," Bobby says. But through your experienced eyes, you know he's up to something else.

55.name: Jetpack Dance
55.description: "It's like she doesn't even know I exist," you hear him mutter to himself. This upgrade allows Bobby to perform sideflips through the air with minor combat bonus.

56.name: Whirling Skyblade
56.description: "It's Natalia," he admits. "She only cares about her books." How can you not feel pity for the poor guy? Buy him this upgrade. At least he'll do more DPS.

57.name: Roast Monsters
57.description: Betty Clicker and Lindeoven pair up to produce delicious food for the team.

58.name: Combustible Air
58.description: This magic seems extremely dangerous. Once the spell is cast, the air can burst into flames with a single spark.

59.name: Inner Fire
59.description: "With this magic, I can concentrate large amounts of heat on very specific, small locations in space. I will effectively set fire to the insides of our enemies."

60.name: The Floor is Lava
60.description: "I used to play this game as a child. I can turn it into a reality for our enemies with this spell," he says.

61.name: Abandoned Regret
61.description: Though he swore to uphold his vows to protect his King, the guard must move on with his life. "It will take some effort," he says.

62.name: Offensive Strategies
62.description: "I no longer protect my King. He has lost his way, and I am in your service now." He is willing to learn new fighting strategies.

63.name: Combat Strategy
63.description: As of late, the mood of Sir George II has improved significantly. This upgrade provides a massive improvement to George's DPS.

64.name: Burning Blade
64.description: Lindeoven can enchant Sir George's weapon with fire.

65.name: Bag of Holding
65.description: This space-bending bag can store things much bigger than itself. Get Midas one of these so he doesn't have to haul his fortune around with him in the midst of battle.

66.name: Heart of Gold
66.description: Midas can find more gold from your enemies. Where it comes from, you're not really sure. "These are riches beyond belief!" he says. "How can I thank Sir George?"

67.name: Touch of Gold
67.description: This upgrade gives Midas the power to turn things (and enemies!) into gold by touching them. He promises to share the wealth with you.

68.name: Golden Dimension
68.description: "I can open rifts to the Planes of Gold," he says, with madness in his eyes. The rift can only open after killing a monster, and heavy golden furniture falls through.

69.name: Defrosting
69.description: This spell will allow Jerator to cast his spells more effectively because he can see clearly.

70.name: Headbashing
70.description: While his magic is paramount, this upgrade will allow Jerator to smash his enemies in head-to-head combat.

71.name: Iceberg Rain
71.description: Icebergs rain down from the sky, smashing your enemies.

72.name: Glacierstorm
72.description: A hurricane of massive glaciers forms in the sky. They fall on your enemies.

73.name: Rise of the Dead
73.description: Abaddon can raise the corpses of the fallen, to fight by your side.

74.name: Curse of the Dark God
74.description: "To call this a 'Curse' is a misnomer, mortal. This power is a blessing."

75.name: Epidemic Evil
75.description: "The powers of darkness breed more power," he says. Abaddon is kind of scary.

76.name: The Dark Ritual
76.description: The ground beneath Abaddon glows with runes. He beckons for you to help him with his final ritual.

77.name: Heaven's Hand
77.description: The eastern gods bless Ma Zhu with a portion of their holy might increasing Ma Zhu's damage.

78.name: Plasma Arc
78.description: Ma Zhu sparks and crackles with electricity. The heat from a focused arc can inflict incredible damage.

79.name: Ancient Wrath
79.description: "I fear you may not be balancing the powers of the Gods," Ma Zhu tells you, hinting at this upgrade. "Abaddon is a dangerous one."

80.name: Pet Dragon
80.description: "I can go get my dragon, if you like. His name is Bashe, and he eats elephants," Ma Zhu says.

81.name: Smite
81.description: "I am here to help you, mortal. Grant me this power and you will be rewarded with the loot of many corpses."

82.name: Genesis Research
82.description: "Foolish mortal! You have let Abaddon grow too powerful," he scolds you. "We must undo what has been done! It will take time. Do not let Abaddon know."

83.name: Prepare the Rebeginning
83.description: With a terrifying rumble, the ground and the skies ripple. Amenhotep glows brilliantly with power as he prepares the final act.

84.name: Eye in the Sky
84.description: The birds in the sky can spot when our enemies are their most vulnerable.

85.name: Critters
85.description: They are small, but they make up for it in numbers and ferocity.

86.name: Beastmode
86.description: The Beastmaster murmurs an incantation. Fur sprouts from his skin, quills shoot from his back. He bares his claws and teeth, which bear resemblance to a bear.

87.name: Sacrificial Lamb's Blood
87.description: "Bathe our heroes with the blood of the sacrificed to increase their strength and stamina."

88.name: Hand-to-Head Combat
88.description: "Fresh skulls for the taking, one of my favorite pastimes."

89.name: War Scream
89.description: Athena takes in a deep breath and lets out a hellish scream that reverberates miles across land and sea. Monsters tremble in its wake.

90.name: Bloodlust
90.description: Taste for blood thickens as enemies fall to Athena's feet. Her hunger drives her DPS through the roof.

91.name: Boiling Blood
91.description: Angering the Goddess of War will totally ruin someone's day.

92.name: Lasso of Love
92.description: "Anyone trapped in my lasso falls head over heels in love with me."

93.name: Love Potion
93.description: One little taste and enemies practically kill each other for Aphrodite's affection.

94.name: Love Hurts
94.description: "All is destroyed in love and war," says Aphrodite.

95.name: Kiss of Death
95.description: "Pucker up sweetheart, today's your unlucky day."

96.name: Dancing Blades
96.description: Swords dance in the wind, dicing and chopping enemies into bits and pieces.

97.name: Annoying Winds
97.description: Strong gusts of wind break down enemy morale.

98.name: Bladestorm
98.description: "Amass any and all weapons and throw them into this tornado I've conjured," says Shinatobe.  Pieces of sharp metal twirl violently at the edges of the tornado.

99.name: Eye of the Storm
99.description: A storm of epic proportions, perhaps the biggest storm in history, to constantly ravage your enemies.

100.name: Embalming Fluid
100.description: Having drunk the town dry, Ivan must now resort to embalming fluid to prevent the shakes.

101.name: State of the Art Fishing Gear
101.description: "We should be able to buy all this spiffy new gear because we've been selling off all the extra fish we didn't need. Now we can haul in a bigger load!"

102.name: World Famous Cookbook
102.description: "This is the most famous cookbook ever written. It contains recipes that make your clicks do huge damage."

103.name: Lacquer
103.description: Apply to a big stick for durability and strength.

104.name: Art of Swordfighting
104.description: This rare book was co-authored by three ancient sword masters. "I know it's expensive, but I think it's well worth it."

105.name: King's Pardon
105.description: "Even though he lost his way, my King was still mine to protect and I felt much regret leaving his side. This pardon has lifted a great weight off my shoulders."

106.name: ASCENSION
106.description: Glowing bright magma chasms open up in the distance as Amenhotep prepares the incantation that will destroy this universe. "Whenever you're ready," he says, with arms crossed, tapping his foot.

116.name: Sweeping Strikes
116.description: "I dare any to approach," proclaims Bobby. Swinging his blade back and forth, side to side, Bobby creates an impenetrable sphere of cold hard steel.

117.name: Gold Blade
117.description: Forged from riches of his fallen foes, the golden blade is the most expensive sword ever made.

119.name: Icy Touch
119.description: Jerator's frigid hands can instantly freeze enemies where they stand. They're also used to make drinks ice cold.

120.name: Red Whip
120.description: "I pride myself as a great General because I keep my troops in line." Grant whips his army into shape to prepare for battle.

121.name: Art of War
121.description: "I pride myself as a great General because I continue to increase my knowledge in warfare," says Grant.

122.name: Battle Plan
122.description: "I pride myself as a great General because I devise plans to destroy my enemies," he says.

123.name: Top of the Line Gear
123.description: "I changed my mind about why I'm such a great General. I pride myself as a great General because I buy my troops the best equipment," says Grant.

124.name: Ice Age
124.description: Decreases temperature of the world by 15 degrees.

125.name: Book of Winter
125.description: "It's a really cold book. Don't touch it, because it will freeze your hand off," Frostleaf explains.

126.name: Frozen Stare
126.description: Frostleaf penetrates deep into the souls of his enemies, freezing them in place for eternity.

127.name: Frigid Enchant
127.description: Frostleaf enchants everyone's weapons with icy energy that decreases enemy armor tremendously.

133.name: Lost Soul
133.description: Shhhhh... don't tell him he's part of your group. A man with nothing to lose is most dangerous and thats how he should stay.

135.name: Raging Bull
135.description: This upgrade will send him over the edge. Anger may cloud his judgment, but his strength will increase.

136.name: Dark Soul
136.description: "AHHHh UUghh...I can't keep it inside any longer! I'm afraid its too late, there's no stopping it now."

138.name: Resurrection
138.description: Breathes new life into heroes with lost hope.

139.name: Band of Brothers
139.description: "Stand by one another. There's strength in numbers."

140.name: Medic
140.description: With all the fighting going on, its a wonder how there's no medical staff on board.

141.name: Fully Charged
141.description: "One speech is all it takes to put a fire under their asses."

143.name: Interference
143.description: It's part of the job description.

144.name: Surveillance
144.description: "There's nothing that goes around here without me knowing so NO funny business."

145.name: Camouflage
145.description: "Good news is if I have to go to the bathroom I can use part of my disguise."

146.name: Revive
146.description: Brings the dead back to life.

148.name: Pesticide
148.description: "Masks on! Lets not let what happened to Ruben happen to anyone else. I don't want anybody throwing up all over my sandwich again or you're fired just like Ruben."

149.name: Rejuvenating Seeds
149.description: A food source for every creature walking this earth.

150.name: Green Scroll
150.description: Unlocks secrets of the green ring.

151.name: Split Earth
151.description: Great for planting seeds and burying bodies.

153.name: Travel Supplies
153.description: Equipped with everything you need. Includes flashlight, sleeping gear, and lets not forget Bloop mace.

154.name: Portal
154.description: "Watch your step unless you're my mother-in-law. Just kidding, I sent her through one of these last Wednesday."

155.name: Travel Potion
155.description: "Bottoms up. You don't want travel sickness do you? It's much like sea sickness, but the effects come out the other end."

156.name: Traveling Sword
156.description: "To protect against bandits of course. Don't worry, I have a license for this."

158.name: Heart Juice
158.description: "Can't start the day without a hearty breakfast. Eggs, toast, bacon and some heart juice to wash it all down."

159.name: Luscious Lips
159.description: Once you lay your eyes on them, you won't be able to look away.

160.name: Lovers' Quarrel
160.description: "I'm one lucky gal. With a hoard of young tough men to do my fighting for me, I don't have to lift a finger."

161.name: Love at First Sight
161.description: "Don't hate me because I'm beautiful. Love me because I'm powerful." Aphrodite glares at her.

163.name: Fighting For Dummies
163.description: A how-to on becoming the ultimate fighter.

165.name: Red Sword
165.description: "My trusty companion. There's no one I'd rather go into battle with."

166.name: Flaming Red Sword
166.description: "Thanks for the DPS boost, Broyle. I owe you one."

168.name: Meditation
168.description: "The burden of protecting everyone in all the worlds can be stressful. Sometimes I just need some time to myself."

169.name: Travel Boots
169.description: "You should probably get these for me. My boots are falling apart and I won't be able to travel across worlds without them."

170.name: Peacekeeper
170.description: It is said that the Peacekeeper never needs sharpening.

171.name: Blinding Light
171.description: The light at the end of the tunnel. The tunnel of life.

172.name: Pro-Aging
172.description: Speed up a monster's internal clock. One second for us will become a year for them.

173.name: Slice and Dice
173.description: The Yellow Dimensional Ranger is the fastest blade slinger in the west. This training will further increase her speed.

174.name: Time Travel
174.description: "I can kill you before you get born!" she yells.

175.name: Alter Time
175.description: "Let's just slow everything down shall we? There, that's better. Who says time is never on our side?"

180.name: Diamond Arrowheads
180.description: You don't think twice when Chiron requests expensive arrowheads. You heard somewhere that diamonds are strong, so it seems reasonable.

181.name: Diamond Bow
181.description: You're pretty certain diamond does not have the ideal tensile characteristics for a bow, but Chiron seems to know what he's doing.

182.name: Diamond Horseshoes
182.description: There's no way this is going to help his archery, but every time you give him what he wants he performs better. No reason to stop now.

183.name: Huge Bag of Diamonds
183.description: Chiron has given up all pretext of a pragmatic motivation for his love of diamonds. He hands you an empty sack with the word 'shinies' and a crude drawing of a happy centaur on it.

184.name: Charging Exercises
184.description: Putting in the time every morning to do a set of charging drills and strength building exercises can go a long way toward improving minotaur combat performance. Moloch knows not to skip leg day.

185.name: Horn Sharpening
185.description: Regular maintenance is required for optimal monster penetration.

186.name: Diamond Bullshoes
186.description: Moloch has been eyeing Chiron's flashy new hoofwear and threatens to go on strike if he is not similarly compensated.

187.name: Labyrinthium Axe
187.description: Forged from an ore found in the ancient labyrinths known only to his people, Moloch's most prized possession is as much a symbol of pride for him as it is a sign of doom for his enemies.

188.name: Blacker Powder
188.description: Bomber Max is the sole proprietor of a nearby micro-boomery, where he crafts artisanal explosives using only the finest quality of locally sourced fuels and oxidizers.

189.name: Shorter Fuses
189.description: The shorter the fuse, the sooner he throws the bomb. The sooner he throws the bomb, the sooner he is picking up another bomb and lighting the fuse.

190.name: Goggle Cleaning Solution
190.description: Imagine how much more dangerous he will be when he can actually see what he is doing.

191.name: MTR Gold Mining
191.description: Bomber Max assures you that Monstertop Removal is the latest in gold mining technologies, but he quickly changes the subject when anyone brings up a concern for the environmental impact.

192.name: Quad-Wielding
192.description: Being able to wield four weapons at once allows Gog to threaten his enemies from several directions simultaneously.

193.name: Four-Wielding
193.description: Frequent biambidexterity exercises allow Gog to hold four weapons while many others struggle with two.

194.name: 4-Wielding
194.description: With this upgrade, Gog can wield more than three (but fewer than five) weapons.

195.name: Multi-Weapon Training
195.description: Gog tries desperately to teach each hero how to wield four weapons. He can never quite figure out why they don't seem to get it, but they all get stronger in the process.

1.name: Cid, the Helpful Adventurer
1.description: This nice young fighter showed up to take some of those clicks off your fingers.

2.name: Treebeast
2.description: A series of slow, wooden grunts from this creature indicates to you that it is friendly. It must have come from the Great Forest.

3.name: Ivan, the Drunken Brawler
3.description: Once a prized fighter, Ivan can now be seen frequenting taverns challenging foes in his drunken stupor.

4.name: Brittany, Beach Princess
4.description: "Are we going on an adventure? Like, you know, ohmygod?"

5.name: The Wandering Fisherman
5.description: He wouldn't tell you his name, but maybe you'd rather not know. His spear is good for catching fish, and popping bloops.

6.name: Betty Clicker
6.description: This world-renowned master chef is aligned with your interests for only one reason. She goes out of her way to gather only the freshest ingredients for her recipes, including her famous Fat Bat Fondue.

7.name: The Masked Samurai
7.description: His menacing weapon will no doubt prove useful to you. He says he was once a great leader in the eastern lands, but you're not sure whether or not to believe him.

8.name: Leon
8.description: This walking lion-creature seems friendly enough, but something seems very unnatural about it - especially its face. Its claws seem sharp enough, however, to help you kill some monsters.

9.name: The Great Forest Seer
9.description: News travels fast, and even the Trees can hear. They sent the Seer of the Great Forest to assist you in your journey.

10.name: Alexa, Assassin
10.description: She gives you a name that you are sure is not real. She will help you, but you should probably be careful around her.

11.name: Natalia, Ice Apprentice
11.description: Not everyone is capable of magic, but Natalia has shown much promise. She is an apprentice of the renowned Ice Wizard, Jerator.

12.name: Mercedes, Duchess of Blades
12.description: The best warriors are flocking to you for a chance to participate in this madness we call an adventure. Her blade is really sharp, and she will gladly put it to good use by chopping off heads in your service.

13.name: Bobby, Bounty Hunter
13.description: He claims to be the best mercenary money can buy. And by your best judgement, he does appear to be very skilled. Except with that strange contraption on his back, he seems to have developed a habit of frequently spiralling through the air and smashing head-first into the ground.

14.name: Broyle Lindeoven, Fire Mage
14.description: This mage is the most efficient means for turning gold into fireballs. Lindeoven was hired many years ago to oppose Jerator in the Third War of the Skies, but it is well-known that he only won on account of the physical miscalculations of his opponent.

15.name: Sir George II, King's Guard
15.description: He left the service of his king, Midas, when he heard the news of your efforts. He did not say why he left, and in his silence you can sense something amiss. His cunning and expertise in battle can provide valuable DPS to the mobs.

16.name: King Midas
16.description: When his highest guard, George, left to join you, it wasn't long before Midas himself came looking for him. Then it dawned on him that there is more gold to be made at your side than from exploiting his own kingdom. Also he always wanted to try some of Betty Clicker's chocolate covered bloops.

17.name: Referi Jerator, Ice Wizard
17.description: By most accounts, the greatest wizard of all the lands. So powerful, he was hired by the gods on many occasions to fight in their wars. But in the Third War of the Skies, during a powerful incantation, he tripped on a rock and misfired - permanently freezing solid his own head. And lost the war.

18.name: Abaddon
18.description: A great being has taken material form to discuss the massacre you've performed. He demands payment, and offers a compelling amount of power in return. Perhaps you should do what he says.

19.name: Ma Zhu
19.description: He does not reveal his face, but an aura of power betrays who he is. The Eastern Gods have now been alerted to your cause (whatever it is) and this one wants to help. This one will help for a hefty sum of gold.

20.name: Amenhotep
20.description: He stares at you with a smug, knowing look. Perhaps you don't know why you're here, or what you're really doing, but the Gods have taken a definite interest. Why they demand so much money, though, is astounding...

21.name: Beastlord
21.description: As an abandoned child, he would befriend the beasts in the wilderness. He is now known as the Beastlord, and his powers are greater than those of any mortal.

22.name: Athena, Goddess of War
22.description: Born with hate and bloodlust, Athena finds joy in the demise of others. She will gladly drain the life of your enemies.

23.name: Aphrodite, Goddess of Love
23.description: Aphrodite's power lies in her beauty. Her looks can melt the hearts of her foes.

24.name: Shinatobe, Wind Deity
24.description: "The winds have picked up your call for aid," she says. She appears to levitate above the ground, and her presence suggests she holds within her the power of a thousand hurricanes.

25.name: Grant, The General
25.description: Don't be fooled by his mortality. Feared even by the Gods, Grant is a superior military tactician and a great addition to the team. Mostly because he comes with his army of 10,000 soldiers.

26.name: Frostleaf
26.description: Winter comes and goes with his presence. Old as the dawn of time, Frostleaf maintains the balance of the seasons. "It is time for winter. Let's start the season along your side," he says.

27.name: Dread Knight
27.description: Abandoned and forgotten, his heart has been tainted black with hatred and vengeance. He wields the power of a black ring which draws its magic from the darkness of his soul.

28.name: Atlas
28.description: Once a captain of a warship, he was condemned to depths of the sea after his ship was struck. He remained at wheel navigating the rough seas long enough to save the lives of his crew. Lying on the ocean floor for more than a century, he was resurrected and granted the power of the blue ring which draws its strength from his loyal heart.

29.name: Terra
29.description: Overseer of the lands under the forest canopy, the Forest Ranger is sworn to protect it against all threats that may endanger its inhabitants.

30.name: Phthalo
30.description: Able to travel across realms far beyond our world, the Green Ranger cultivates and promotes growth. She will vanquish all monsters that threaten life.

31.name: Orntchya Gladeye, Didensy Banana
31.description: Entrusted with the orange ring, this Ranger provides safe passage across worlds. Her title may only be 'travel guide', but her fists pack quite a wallop.

32.name: Lilin
32.description: There's no way around it. She will ask for your head and you will comply. All who gaze upon her fall under her love spell and people do crazy things for love.

33.name: Cadmia
33.description: An immortal warrior born and bred to fight, has time and time again proven how deadly a sword in her hand can be. She obtained the red ring from defeating the previous Red Dimensional Ranger.

34.name: Alabaster
34.description: Born in the first world, the child of two war heroes, he was destined to become the savior of realms. Endowed with the white ring for being pure of heart, he was the first ranger tasked to protect the multiverse from evil.

35.name: Astraea
35.description: Cocky, spunky, and fearless, there's nothing she can't do. Before you stands the strongest of the rangers. Her ring gives her the power of time travel. She can slay today's monsters yesterday, at a hefty price.

36.name: Chiron
36.description: This talented archer will increase your average number of limbs per hero by roughly 0.05.

37.name: Moloch
37.description: It is rare for a member of his clan to travel above ground, and rarer still for them to offer their services to traveling adventurers, but your reputation precedes you and Moloch cannot resist the temptation to join your cause and see new worlds.

38.name: Bomber Max
38.description: Chief Explosivist. Prime Primer Primer. Detonation Sensation. Guy with a bomb.

39.name: Gog
39.description: Nobody is quite sure how long Gog has been following you, or what his intentions are, but he seems to be collecting discarded weapons from your previous battles. Perhaps he could be compelled to fight beside you.

41.name: Deadly
41.description: Get %1 Critical Clicks in one second.

42.name: Assassin
42.description: Get %1 Critical Clicks in one second

61.flavorText: How can one hamster be so hated throughout the land?
61.name: Bounty: Omeet

63.flavorText: He used to be a Kung Fu master, but he really let himself go. Probably one too many pizzas.
63.name: Bounty: Woodchip, the Rodent

64.flavorText: She's very angry that you've been smashing her babies.
64.name: Bounty: Queen of Bloops

66.flavorText: Once an Ancient, Duke Rashon became mortal when a group of 5 adventurers stole his Aegis. Good thing, too, because he's standing in your way of getting this achievement.
66.name: Bounty: Rashon, the Duke

67.flavorText: A legendary boss from another realm, he's here a on a secret mission.
67.name: Bounty: The Dark Wizard

68.flavorText: He'll probably come back if you kill him.
68.name: Bounty: Tako, Head of the Octopi
68.description: Defeat Tako, Head of the Octopi.

69.flavorText: This isn't even his final form.
69.name: Bounty: Tako Returns

92.name: Out with the old and in with the new...again.

103.flavorText: How did you find so many?
103.name: The Collector

130.name: Kind of a lot of skills

1.name: Treasures
1.description: Gain %1% gold instantly. Based on DPS.

3.name: Refresher
3.description: Refreshes all ability cooldowns except for Dark Ritual.

6.name: 2x Damage Multiplier
6.description: Double all of your DPS forever!

1.effectDescription: +%1% DPS when idle (no clicks for 60 seconds)
1.name: Abandonment

5.effectDescription: +%1% Chance of double rubies from clickable treasures, when you get a ruby.
5.name: Luck

8.effectDescription: +%1 seconds to duration of Metal Detector
8.name: Battery Life

9.effectDescription: +%1 seconds to duration of Golden Clicks
9.name: Thieves

10.effectDescription: +%1 seconds to duration of Lucky Strikes
10.name: Accuracy

12.effectDescription: +%1 seconds to duration of Super Clicks
12.name: Wallops

24.effectDescription: +%1% Gold gained from monsters when idle (no clicks for 60 seconds)
24.name: Freedom

3.flavorText: The ancients have a lingering, noticeable effect on everyone who approaches them. As you approach Solomon, you can't help but reflect on your recent decisions. What has this world done to you that so many of its creatures deserve to die? Even the monsters in other universes are not safe from your wrath. You realize that you desire to kill them all, and to take all their gold, but you're not entirely sure why... You feel the urge to contemplate many things.
3.name: Solomon, Ancient of Wisdom

4.flavorText: The air suddenly feels cleaner, and the sun shines more brightly. Being near this ancient gives you the sense that you may soon be able to do whatever you wish, and that your responsibilities and obligations to this world are not as relevant as they once were. Leon looks on at you with sorrow… wondering if some day you might leave and never return.
4.effectDescription: +%1% Gold gained from monsters when idle (no clicks for 60 seconds)
4.name: Libertas, Ancient of Freedom

5.flavorText: Getting tired of killing monsters? Need a break? Want to get away, but feel obligated to stay? Now you can have your cake and eat it too!
5.effectDescription: +%1% DPS when idle (no clicks for 60 seconds)
5.name: Siyalatas, Ancient of Abandon

6.flavorText: What happens to your money when you die? Pass as much as you can on to your offspring. There's a lot of gratification in knowing it won't just go to some random jerk who certainly doesn't deserve it.
6.name: Khrysos, Ancient of Inheritance

7.flavorText: Midas walks with you to greet this ancient, and shows you his purse. As you get closer, the cloth material that the purse is made of gets harder. Suddenly, you could swear it turned into leather. "Upgrading this ancient will probably make it more difficult to kill treasure chests. I would leave this one alone," Midas says. "It sounds worthless to me."
7.effectDescription: +%1% Treasure Chest life while Golden Clicks is activated
7.name: Thusia, Ancient of Vaults

8.flavorText: A tingling feeling rises in your spine as you approach Mammon, when visions of gold materialize in your mind. A strange desire for wealth overcomes you as you get closer. From the distance, Midas eyes the ancient with a look bordering on the indecent. Suddenly you feel... what? Is that an extra gold coin in your pocket?
8.name: Mammon, Ancient of Greed

9.flavorText: Line your pockets with the spoils of war, for Mimzee grants booty far greater than before. You smile as she whispers into your ears, "Earn real money!"
9.name: Mimzee, Ancient of Riches

10.flavorText: You feel appreciated as you approach this monument. Your hard work and dedication start to payoff.
10.name: Pluto, Ancient of Wealth

11.flavorText: Your heroes unanimously voice a great amount of displeasure at the notion that you might use this ancient.
11.name: Dogcog, Ancient of Thrift

12.flavorText: Cid walks with you to visit the monument. "Check this out," she says, and flips a coin. Heads. She flips it a few more times. Heads. Heads. Heads. "Every time," she says. A game of cards sounds incredibly tempting at the moment.
12.name: Fortuna, Ancient of Chance

13.flavorText: As you approach the monument your skin reacts to a chilly breeze. Hair stands at the back of your neck and you sense a mystical presence in the air.
13.name: Atman, Ancient of Souls

14.flavorText: Your eyes become sharper. You're able to notice many things.
14.name: Dora, Ancient of Discovery

15.flavorText: You might have felt some guilt about it some time ago, but being near this ancient rids you of any sense of remorse you had for the monsters you've slain. You begin to visualize new ways to strike your foes and kill them more efficiently.
15.name: Bhaal, Ancient of Murder

16.flavorText: Approaching the monument, you begin to feel as if killing monsters is a natural thing in life. It is as necessary as breathing, and eating. A voice startles you from behind. "Death is good" he says. You turn around - it was Abaddon. He was following you. "Their death brings you happiness, and gold. It feels good, does it not?"
16.name: Morgulis, Ancient of Death

17.flavorText: You could spend hours visiting this monument, and when you leave, only minutes will have passed. Your immortal heroes refuse to approach it - but they do not explain why.
17.name: Chronos, Ancient of Time

18.flavorText: There is a putrid stench of death and despair wafting in the air. Your stomach turns sour and you cannot stay long.
18.name: Bubos, Ancient of Diseases

19.flavorText: You are brimming with anger for no apparent reason. Betty asks "Are you okay?" You blow over and shoot a barrage of insults about Betty's cooking until she breaks down and cries. You feel no regret for what you've done until long after you leave the ancient...
19.name: Fragsworth, Ancient of Wrath

20.flavorText: It dawns on you that if you could just do everything all at once, all of your problems can be solved.
20.name: Vaagur, Ancient of Impatience

21.flavorText: A darkness radiates from the monument, causing many things to become difficult to see. You catch a brief glimpse of movement nearby... was that Abaddon? Upgrading this ancient will allow you to sneak past monsters when exploring.
21.effectDescription: -%1 monsters required to advance to the next level
21.name: Kumawakamaru, Ancient of Shadows

22.flavorText: The Great Forest Seer walks with you. "This ancient emanates some kind of telekinetic force, causing things nearby to violently shake back-and-forth," he explains. He stops at a certain distance. "You're on your own here." As you get closer, your head begins to oscillate unpleasantly, and with each passing moment, the notion of leaving this place grows more appropriate.
22.name: Chawedo, Ancient of Agitation

23.flavorText: You share a drink with Ivan before visiting the monument. You both put up your dukes and start to brawl, trading blow after blow. The energy surrounding the ancient urges both of you to keep fighting, though you're both beaten and battered.
23.effectDescription: +%1 seconds to duration of Super Clicks
23.name: Hecatoncheir, Ancient of Wallops

24.flavorText: Your blood begins to boil and all you see is white light.
24.name: Berserker, Ancient of Rage

25.flavorText: Alexa accompanies you on your visit to the monument. "The ancient's aura has enhanced my sight. I can more easily detect weaknesses of my foes," she claims.
25.effectDescription: +%1 seconds to duration of Lucky Strikes
25.name: Sniperino, Ancient of Accuracy

26.flavorText: Both you and the fisherman arrive at the monument. You feel compelled to steal a fish from his basket, so you quickly swipe one without him noticing. You look at the prize inside your bag only to notice that you have some gold missing. You quickly give a dirty look to the fisherman only to see him doing the same.
26.effectDescription: +%1 seconds to duration of Golden Clicks
26.name: Kleptos, Ancient of Thieves

27.flavorText: Ma Zhu accompanies you. Unlike most of the other ancients, you notice nothing odd about the aura of this one. "A world I visited once, far away from our own, could have made much better use of the magic of this ancient," he tells you. What wonders must exist in that world...
27.effectDescription: +%1 seconds to duration of Metal Detector
27.name: Energon, Ancient of Battery Life

28.flavorText: You have heard much of this ancient from the tales of bards even though you never believed them to be truth. Your doubts quickly fade as you feel a surge of immense power while you step closer to  the pulsating crystal.
28.name: Argaiv, Ancient of Enhancement

29.flavorText: It has been days since you last slept, yet you do not feel at all tired. The ancient has been driving you all along. You wonder how much longer you can go on; there is no end in sight.
29.effectDescription: +%1% DPS per click combo  ( active clicking )
29.name: Juggernaut, Ancient of Momentum

30.flavorText: This ancient grants you supreme vision beyond what your eyes can see. The longer you are awake, the greater your powers become. Sleep has now become a hindrance to your path to what you desire. Sacrifices must be made.
30.name: Iris, Ancient of Vision

31.flavorText: Forged from a million lucky coins, this monument is the strongest lucky charm in existence. Place your bets, go toe to toe with death, fight with your mother-in-law and live to tell the tale! Nothing can possibly go wrong when you're in the vicinity of Revolc. Your heroes recommend you haul it with you for when you find clickables.
31.effectDescription: +%1% Chance of double rubies from clickable treasures, when you get a ruby.
31.name: Revolc, Ancient of Luck
